result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Commit no acts which rise to the level of probable cause in violation of the criminal laws of the state of Wisconsin, or of any other state, or of the United States of America.
-Comply with all conditions of bail or bond in this case.
-Pay a fine of $20 plus felony court costs. 
-Defendant will keep Douglas County Clerk of Courts informed of his address and telephone number at all times, and stipulates that the sending of notice by regular mail to the address on file with the Clerk of Courts constitutes sufficient notice of any court hearings scheduled in this matter.  The non-appearance of the defendant may result in the issuance of an arrest warrant. 
-Defendant will successfully complete Douglas County Treatment Court as a condition of this agreement.
Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.
Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.

ADDRESS INFO for Pamela Grace McMullin

11:36 AM Defendant Pamela Grace McMullin in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Pamela Grace McMullin.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. State notes defendant in treatment court program. Defendant to enter into a DJOC for a period of 18 months. Attorney Rosenthal is in agreement. Defendant pleads no contest to charge.   Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.  The Defendant understands all the rights she is waiving by her plea.  The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is deferred pursuant to the terms of the agreement.

11:02 AM Defendant Pamela Grace McMullin in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Pamela Grace McMullin.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rosenthal received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty plea. Attorney Rosenthal asks for status conference. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:22 AM Defendant Pamela Grace McMullin not in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Pamela Grace McMullin.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. State notes defendant currently in Treatment Court program asks for another status to be set. Court sets arraignment and clerk to send notice.
Arraignment scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

1:28 PM Prosecuting attorney Angela M Wilson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Pamela Grace McMullin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman appeared by video for Pamela Grace McMullin. Attorney Hoffman updated defendant's address. Attorney Hoffman received complaint, waives reading and pleads not guilty. State requests $1,000 cash bail with condition ofno use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. Defendant is currently on probation supervision. State reviews defendant's priors and was in custody for time while cases were pending so not several fta's. Attorney Hoffman states defendant is a lifelong resident. Defendant attempts making statement and Attorney Hoffman advises not to. Court orders $1,000 cash bail and condition of no use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 11:30 am.
